oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Artist in Residence - Earl Scruggs - End of set one and set two - 2004-09-14
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Second of four Artist in Residence performances by Earl Scruggs from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on September 14, 2004. Set two of two. Special guests include Gary Scruggs, Billy Thomas, Aubrey Haney, Rob Ickes, Jon Randall, Randy Scruggs, Marty Stuart, Mac Wiseman, Cordell, Larry, Jerry Douglas, Dan Tyminski, Cowboy Jack Clement, Kris Kristofferson.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Earl Scruggs; Gary Scruggs; Billy Thomas; Aubrey Haney; Rob Ickes; Jon Randall Stewart; Randy Scruggs; Marty Stuart; Mac Wiseman; Larry Cordell; Jerry Douglas; Dan Tyminski; Jack Clement; Kris Kristofferson;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Program continuing from previous tape (RS.2014.0060). John Henry The Steel Driving Man (Earl Scruggs and Marty Stuart-banjo and mandolin) -- Highway 40 Blues (Larry Cordell - vocal) -- Blue Eyes Crying In The Rain (Jack Clement - vocal) -- Sunday Morning Coming Down (Kris Kristofferson - vocal) -- Earl's Breakdown (Earl Scruggs - banjo) -- Intermission (Short Break) -- Paul And Silas (Earl Scruggs - guitar, Gary Scruggs - vocal) -- Who'll Sing For Me (Marty Stuart - vocal) -- Mac Wiseman tells stories about travelling with Lester Flatt and Earl Scruggs -- Jimmy Brown The Newsboy (Mac Wiseman-vocal and Earl Scruggs-guitar) -- Soldier's Joy (Earl Scruggs-banjo) -- I'm Gonna Settle Down (Larry Cordell-vocal) -- I'll Be All Smiles Tonight (Mac Wiseman-vocal) -- Someday We'll Meet Again Sweetheart (Jon Randall) -- S-E-R-I-O-U-S-L-Y (Jack Clement-vocal) -- Foggy Mountain Rock (Jerry Douglas-dobro) -- I'm A Man Of Constant Sorrow (Dan Tyminski-vocal) -- Here Comes That Rainbow Again (Kris Kristofferson-vocal) -- The Ballad Of Jed Clampett (Marty Stuart and Jon Randall-vocal) -- Foggy Mountain Breakdown (Earl Scruggs-banjo) -- Short Record Signal Break -- Encore -- Lonesome Reuben (Earl Scruggs-banjo) -- Closing Comments (Kyle Young)
